valleynewslive.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for NBC affiliate station KVLY-TV and CBS affiliate KXJB, covering news in and around Fargo, North Dakota.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

KVLY and KXJB are owned by Gray Television, a publicly traded, Atlanta-based media company that entered the broadcasting industry in the mid-20th century. In June 2018, Gray announced its purchase of the private, Alabama-based Raycom Media for $3.6 billion. Pending FCC approval, the acquisition will significantly expand Gray’s market reach and make it one of the largest broadcast groups in the U.S.

Gray Television is not identified on Valleynewslive.com as the site and stations’ owner, beyond a small copyright notice for Gray’s digital media subsidiary. Despite four emails and two phone calls with representatives designated by senior managers, Gray Television did not respond to NewsGuard’s questions about its display of corporate ownership.
